meanings.definition: To proceed or travel in a specific direction.
meanings.sent1: The little ant was wending its way through the grass.
meanings.sent2: The river was wending gently through the valley.
meanings.sent3: The snail was wending so slowly that even the turtle laughed.
meanings.sent4: The road wending through the forest seemed like a mysterious path.
meanings.sent5: The wending stream sparkled under the sunlight.

meanings.definition: To make one's way slowly or gradually.
meanings.sent1: She was wending her way through the crowded market.
meanings.sent2: The ivy was wending its tendrils up the old stone wall.
meanings.sent3: The caterpillar was wending along as if it had all the time in the world.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were wending through the memories of her childhood.
meanings.sent5: The smoke wending its way out of the chimney painted a picture in the sky.
